alert.note: Alert for Cottle (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued October 04 at 3:22PM CDT until October 04 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM CDT FOR EASTERN COTTLE COUNTY... At 321 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles northeast of Chalk, or 12 miles east of Paducah, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. At 313 PM CDT, a wind gust of 59 mph was measured by the mesonet near Hackberry. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Paducah, Chalk, Swearingen, and Hackberry. HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
